content:
Diagnosis:		Sarcomatoid pleural mesothelioma

Background:		Initial diagnosis via right VATS pleural biopsy March 2022
Sept 22: Staging PET-CT demonstrates multifocal pleural disease with chest wall invasion
Dec 22: Repeat biopsy confirms sarcomatoid subtype with desmoplastic features

Comorbidities:	1) Type 2 diabetes - diet controlled
2) Essential hypertension - stable on ramipril
3) Previous DVT 2020 - completed 6 months anticoagulation
4) Chronic kidney disease stage 3A

Management:	First-line carboplatin/pemetrexed initiated January 2023
CT assessment April 2023 showed partial response
Completed 6 cycles July 2023 with stable disease
Surveillance CT October 2023 demonstrated new right paravertebral mass
December 2023 imaging confirms progression with T8 vertebral body involvement

Current Status:	Being evaluated for METEOR-2 phase II trial

[redacted name] attended clinic today following recent imaging which demonstrates enlargement of the right paravertebral mass with evidence of T8 vertebral body infiltration. He reports gradually worsening right-sided back pain, currently rated 4/10 and requiring regular paracetamol, though remains ambulatory without any concerning neurological symptoms.

I have discussed his case with Dr [redacted name] regarding potential eligibility for the METEOR-2 trial of dual checkpoint inhibition. While awaiting confirmation of trial screening, we are also planning for potential second-line vinorelbine if trial participation is not possible.

We have arranged to review him in clinic in 3 weeks? time with trial screening outcome. If trial participation is not feasible, we will proceed with chemotherapy initiation at that visit.
